turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Master of the Beffi Triptych.
turn.1: What is the Master of the Beffi Triptych?
turn.2: Master of the Beffi Triptych The Master of the Beffi Triptych (active circa 1390 -1425) is an unknown Italian painter of the early 15th century in the region of Abruzzo.
turn.4: The main work of the artists is a three part wooden panel derived from the church of Santa Maria del Ponte in the town of Beffi, now a frazione of Acciano.
turn.6: The central panel depicts an "Enthroned Madonna and Child", while the right panel depicts a "Nativity" with donor and the left panel depicts an "Assumption and Heavenly Coronation of the Virgin".
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: There is speculation about the identity of the painter.
turn.10: He appears to have been influenced by the style of the Sienese painter Taddeo di Bartolo (1362–1422).
turn.12: In addition to panel paintings, this anonymous painter also illuminated manuscripts and created frescoes in the region.
